articles.author: SCOTT BAUER
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A 15-year-old student opened fire inside a study hall at a small Christian school in Wisconsin, killing a teacher and a teenager and prompting a swarm of police officers to descend on the school in response to a second grader's 911 call.
articles.title: A 15-year-old girl fatally shoots a teacher and a teenager at a Christian school in Wisconsin

articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — At a time of heightened political division, Americans' confidence in their country’s judicial system and courts dropped to a record low of 35% this year, according to a new Gallup poll.
articles.title: Americans' trust in nation's court system hits record low, survey finds

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: A senior Russian general was killed Tuesday by a bomb hidden in a scooter outside his apartment building in Moscow, a day after Ukraine’s security service leveled criminal charges against him. A Ukrainian official said the service carried out the attack.
articles.title: A top Russian general is killed in a Moscow bombing claimed by Ukraine

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: An Israeli strike in Gaza killed at least eight people from the same family, most of them women and children, Palestinian medics said Tuesday. The strike late Monday hit a house in Gaza City’s central neighborhood of Daraj, according to the Gaza Health Ministry’s ambulance and emergency service.
articles.title: Middle East latest: Israeli strike in Gaza kills at least 8 from the same family, Palestinians say

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: After months of deadlock, Israel and Hamas appear to be moving closer toward a ceasefire to end their 14-month war.
articles.title: Negotiators say Israel and Hamas are inching toward a ceasefire deal. This is what it may look like

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK, JAKE OFFENHARTZ and JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A judge Monday refused to throw out President-elect Donald Trump’s hush money conviction because of the U.S.
articles.title: Judge rejects Trump’s bid to toss hush money conviction because of Supreme Court immunity ruling

articles.author: PHILIP MARCELO
articles.description: RIVERHEAD, N.Y. (AP) — The New York architect facing murder charges in a string of deaths known as the Gilgo Beach killings was charged on Tuesday in the death of a seventh woman.
articles.title: Suspect in Gilgo Beach serial killings is charged in the death of a seventh woman

articles.author: CHARLOTTE GRAHAM-McLAY
articles.description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand (AP) — A powerful magnitude 7.3 earthquake struck just off the coast of Vanuatu on Tuesday, causing widespread destruction in the South Pacific island nation as the injured began arriving at a hospital and unconfirmed reports of casualties emerged.
articles.title: Magnitude 7.3 earthquake causes widespread damage in Pacific island nation of Vanuatu

articles.author: LAURAN NEERGAARD
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — An Alabama woman is recovering well after a pig kidney transplant last month that freed her from eight years of dialysis, the latest effort to save human lives with animal organs.
articles.title: An Alabama woman is doing well after the latest experimental pig kidney transplant

articles.author: DEEPTI HAJELA
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The chairs stay occupied at 12 Pell. Client after client, they come through the tiny barbershop on a narrow side street in Manhattan’s Chinatown. They come for the cuts, sure.
articles.title: Younger Asian Americans navigate something new to their generation: Taking up space
